But when those senses weaken another heightens. Memory. Memory becomes your partner. You nurture it. You hold it. You dance with it.
quotes.author: Mitch Albom

quotes.quote: Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra
quotes.book: When You Come to a Fork in the Road, Take It!: Inspiration and Wisdom from One of Baseball's Greatest Heroes

quotes.quote: If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: When I was your age, television was called books.
quotes.author: William Goldman

quotes.quote: Can you understand? Someone, somewhere, can you understand me a little, love me a little? For all my despair, for all my ideals, for all that - I love life. But it is hard, and I have so much - so very much to learn.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.quote: I felt like crying but nothing came out. it was just a sort of sad sickness, sick sad, when you can't feel any worse. I think you know it. I think everybody knows it now and then. but I think I have known it pretty often, too often.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.quote:
Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee
And I'll forgive Thy great big one on me.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: You are not your job, you're not how much money you have in the bank. You are not the car you drive. You're not the contents of your wallet. You are not your fucking khakis. You are all singing, all dancing crap of the world.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.quote: Even in the Future the Story Begins with Once Upon a Time.
quotes.author: Marissa Meyer

quotes.quote: If I loved you less, I might be able to talk about it more.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
quotes.author: A.A. Milne

quotes.quote: Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met.
quotes.author: Marguerite Duras

quotes.quote: Because you can't argue with all the fools in the world. It's easier to let them have their way, then trick them when they're not paying attention.
quotes.author: Christopher Paolini

quotes.quote:
I thought I'd lie on the floor and writhe in pain for a while," he grunted, "It relaxes me."
"It does? Oh - you're being sarcastic. That's a good sign probably.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare

quotes.quote: Time is the longest distance between two places.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.quote: the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.quote: What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do.
quotes.author: Alan Bennett

quotes.quote: She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring.
quotes.author: Zelda Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine
quotes.book: A Letter Addressed to the Abbe Raynal on the Affairs of North America

quotes.quote: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: No one has ever become poor by giving.
quotes.author: Anne Frank
quotes.book: diary of Anne Frank: the play

quotes.quote: No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan

quotes.quote: I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.quote: The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.
quotes.author: Anna Quindlen

quotes.quote: My name is Celaena Sardothien. But it makes no difference if my name's Celaena or Lillian or Bitch, because I'd still beat you, no matter what you call me.
quotes.author: Sarah J. Maas

quotes.quote: You see I usually find myself among strangers because I drift here and there trying to forget the sad things that happened to me.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, "It might have been.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.quote: It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quotes.quote: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: Did you ever think that in a past life Alec was an old woman with ninety cats who was always yelling at the neighborhood kids to get off her lawn? Because I do,
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare

quotes.quote: إن المرأة تحب رجلها ليس لأنه أقوى الرجال، و لا أوسمهم، و لا أغناهم، بل لأنه هو.. بضعفه و قوته.. و الحب ليس إستعراض قوة لكنه طاقة عطاء دافئة مستمرة
quotes.author: أحمد خالد توفيق

quotes.quote: Whenever you read a cancer booklet or website or whatever, they always list depression among the side effects of cancer. But, in fact, depression is not a side effect of cancer. Depression is a side effect of dying.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.quote: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: What I need is the dandelion in the spring. The bright yellow that means rebirth instead of destruction. The promise that life can go on, no matter how bad our losses. That it can be good again.
quotes.author: Suzanne Collins

quotes.quote: Books are my friends, my companions. They make me laugh and cry and find meaning in life.
quotes.author: Christopher Paolini

quotes.quote: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: If you are going through hell, keep going.
quotes.author: Winston S. Churchill

quotes.quote: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: They love their hair because they're not smart enough to love something more interesting.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.quote: I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury
quotes.book: Zen in the Art of Writing: Releasing the Creative Genius Within You

quotes.quote: As usual, there is a great woman behind every idiot.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.quote:
That does it," said Jace. "I'm going to get you a dictionary for Christmas this year."
"Why?" Isabelle said.
"So you can look up 'fun.' I'm not sure you know what it means.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare

quotes.quote: It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it.
quotes.author: Dale Carnegie
quotes.book: How to Win Friends and Influence People

quotes.quote: Beneath the makeup and behind the smile I am just a girl who wishes for the world.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.quote: Nothing of me is original. I am the combined effort of everyone I've ever known.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.quote: But who prays for Satan? Who, in eighteen centuries, has had the common humanity to pray for the one sinner that needed it most?
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something.
quotes.author: William Goldman
quotes.book: William Goldman: Four Screenplays with Essays

quotes.quote: Why do you go away? So that you can come back. So that you can see the place you came from with new eyes and extra colors. And the people there see you differently, too. Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.quote: There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon, and the anger of a gentle man.
quotes.author: Patrick Rothfuss

quotes.quote: I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
quotes.author: William Faulkner

quotes.quote: I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana.
quotes.author: Anthony G. Oettinger

quotes.quote: Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed. If people all over the world...would do this, it would change the earth.
quotes.author: William Faulkner

quotes.quote: I don't trust people who don't love themselves and tell me, 'I love you.' ... There is an African saying which is: Be careful when a naked person offers you a shirt.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote:
Don't Just

Don't just learn, experience.
Don't just read, absorb.
Don't just change, transform.
Don't just relate, advocate.
Don't just promise, prove.
Don't just criticize, encourage.
Don't just think, ponder.
Don't just take, give.
Don't just see, feel.
Don’t just dream, do.
Don't just hear, listen.
Don't just talk, act.
Don't just tell, show.
Don't just exist, live.
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience from it.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: The difference between thealmost rightalmost rightword and therightrightword is really a large matter. ’tis the difference between the lightning bug and the lightning.
quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.book: The Wit and Wisdom of Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Being crazy isn't enough.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.quote: I don't go looking for trouble. Trouble usually finds me.
quotes.author: Katie McGarry

quotes.quote: It's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door. You step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's no knowing where you might be swept off to.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: What I want is to be needed. What I need is to be indispensable to somebody. Who I need is somebody that will eat up all my free time, my ego, my attention. Somebody addicted to me. A mutual addiction.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.quote: Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quotes.quote: All your life, you will be faced with a choice. You can choose love or hate…I choose love.
quotes.author: Johnny Cash

quotes.quote: Always find opportunities to make someone smile, and to offer random acts of kindness in everyday life.
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote:
It's just that most really good-looking people are stupid, so I exceed expectations.'
'Right, it's primarily his hotness,' I said.
'It can be sort of blinding,' he said.
'It actually did blind our friend Isaac,' I said.
'Terrible tragedy, that. But can I help my own deadly beauty?'
'You cannot.'
'It is my burden, this beautiful face.'
'Not to mention your body.'

But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. quotes.quote:
Perhaps the greatest faculty our minds possess is the ability to cope with pain. Classic thinking teaches us of the four doors of the mind, which everyone moves through according to their need.

First is the door of sleep. Sleep offers us a retreat from the world and all its pain. Sleep marks passing time, giving us distance from the things that have hurt us. When a person is wounded they will often fall unconscious. Similarly, someone who hears traumatic news will often swoon or faint. This is the mind's way of protecting itself from pain by stepping through the first door.

Second is the door of forgetting. Some wounds are too deep to heal, or too deep to heal quickly. In addition, many memories are simply painful, and there is no healing to be done. The saying 'time heals all wounds' is false. Time heals most wounds. The rest are hidden behind this door.

Third is the door of madness. There are times when the mind is dealt such a blow it hides itself in insanity. While this may not seem beneficial, it is. There are times when reality is nothing but pain, and to escape that pain the mind must leave reality behind.

Last is the door of death. The final resort. Nothing can hurt us after we are dead, or so we have been told.
quotes.author: Patrick Rothfuss

quotes.quote: Any fool knows men and women think differently at times, but the biggest difference is this. Men forget, but never forgive; women forgive, but never forget.

quotes.quote: Before you, Bella, my life was like a moonless night. Very dark, but there were stars, points of light and reason. ...And then you shot across my sky like a meteor. Nothing had changed, but my eyes were blinded by the light. I couldn’t see the stars anymore. And there was no more reason, for anything.

you think, How can a body withstand this?

no charming smile, no violet eyes,

Dignity
/ˈdignitē/ noun

1. The moment you realize that the person you cared for has nothing intellectually or spiritually to offer you, but a headache.

2. The moment you realize God had greater plans for you that don’t involve crying at night or sad Pinterest quotes.

3. The moment you stop comparing yourself to others because it undermines your worth, education and your parent’s wisdom.

4. The moment you live your dreams, not because of what it will prove or get you, but because that is all you want to do. People’s opinions don’t matter.

5. The moment you realize that no one is your enemy, except yourself.

6. The moment you realize that you can have everything you want in life. However, it takes timing, the right heart, the right actions, the right passion and a willingness to risk it all. If it is not yours, it is because you really didn’t want it, need it or God prevented it.

7. The moment you realize the ghost of your ancestors stood between you and the person you loved. They really don't want you mucking up the family line with someone that acts anything less than honorable.

8. The moment you realize that happiness was never about getting a person. They are only a helpmate towards achieving your life mission.

9. The moment you believe that love is not about losing or winning. It is just a few moments in time, followed by an eternity of situations to grow from.

10. The moment you realize that you were always the right person. Only ignorant people walk away from greatness.

"Oh, shut up.

quotes.quote: He smiled understandingly-much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it, that you may come across four or five times in life. It faced--or seemed to face--the whole eternal world for an instant, and then concentrated on you with an irresistible prejudice in your favor. It understood you just as far as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you would like to believe in yourself, and assured you that it had precisely the impression of you that, at your best, you hoped to convey.

quotes.quote:
Jesper knocked his head against the hull and cast his eyes heavenward. “Fine. But if Pekka Rollins kills us all, I’m going to get Wylan’s ghost to teach my ghost how to play the flute just so that I can annoy the hell out of your ghost.”
Brekker’s lips quirked. “I’ll just hire Matthias’ ghost to kick your ghost’s ass.”
“My ghost won’t associate with your ghost,” Matthias said primly, and then wondered if the sea air was rotting his brain.

quotes.quote: Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation.

quotes.quote: Say 'provoking' again. Your mouth looks provocative when you do.

quotes.quote:
I crave your mouth, your voice, your hair.
Silent and starving, I prowl through the streets.
Bread does not nourish me, dawn disrupts me, all day
I hunt for the liquid measure of your steps.

I hunger for your sleek laugh,
your hands the color of a savage harvest,
hunger for the pale stones of your fingernails,
I want to eat your skin like a whole almond.

I want to eat the sunbeam flaring in your lovely body,
the sovereign nose of your arrogant face,
I want to eat the fleeting shade of your lashes,

and I pace around hungry, sniffing the twilight,
hunting for you, for your hot heart,
Like a puma in the barrens of Quitratue.
quotes.author: Pablo Neruda

quotes.quote: It’s probably not just by chance that I’m alone. It would be very hard for a man to live with me, unless he’s terribly strong. And if he’s stronger than I, I’m the one who can’t live with him. … I’m neither smart nor stupid, but I don’t think I’m a run-of-the-mill person. I’ve been in business without being a businesswoman, I’ve loved without being a woman made only for love. The two men I’ve loved, I think, will remember me, on earth or in heaven, because men always remember a woman who caused them concern and uneasiness. I’ve done my best, in regard to people and to life, without precepts, but with a taste for justice.

quotes.quote: Is 'fat' really the worst thing a human being can be? Is 'fat' worse than 'vindictive', 'jealous', 'shallow', 'vain', 'boring' or 'cruel'? Not to me.

Must you go? I was rather hoping you'd stay and be a ministering angel, but if you must go, you must."

"None too convincingly. And you're not as pretty to look at as Tessa is," Jem said, closing his eyes as he leaned back against the pillow.

Jem still had his eyes closed. "If they mean it gives you a headache, they aren't wrong.

quotes.quote: Lolita, light of my life, fire of my loins. My sin, my soul. Lo-lee-ta: the tip of the tongue taking a trip of three steps down the palate to tap, at three, on the teeth. Lo. Lee. Ta. She was Lo, plain Lo, in the morning, standing four feet ten in one sock. She was Lola in slacks. She was Dolly at school. She was Dolores on the dotted line. But in my arms she was always Lolita. Did she have a precursor? She did, indeed she did. In point of fact, there might have been no Lolita at all had I not loved, one summer, an initial girl-child. In a princedom by the sea. Oh when? About as many years before Lolita was born as my age was that summer. You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style. Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, exhibit number one is what the seraphs, the misinformed, simple, noble-winged seraphs, envied. Look at this tangle of thorns.

quotes.quote: Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are god. quotes.quote:
I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes.

Because if you are making mistakes, then you are making new things, trying new things, learning, living, pushing yourself, changing yourself, changing your world. You're doing things you've never done before, and more importantly, you're Doing Something.

So that's my wish for you, and all of us, and my wish for myself. Make New Mistakes. Make glorious, amazing mistakes. Make mistakes nobody's ever made before. Don't freeze, don't stop, don't worry that it isn't good enough, or it isn't perfect, whatever it is: art, or love, or work or family or life.

Whatever it is you're scared of doing, Do it.

Make your mistakes, next year and forever.

quotes.quote: Truth only means something when it's hard to admit.

quotes.quote: I have for the first time found what I can truly love–I have found you. You are my sympathy–my better self–my good angel–I am bound to you with a strong attachment. quotes.quote:
I want to be the friend you fall hopelessly in love with. The one you take into your arms and into your bed and into the private world you keep trapped in your head. I want to be that kind of friend. The one who will memorize the things you say as well as the shape of your lips when you say them. I want to know every curve, every freckle, every shiver of your body.

I want to know where to touch you, I want to know how to touch you. I want to know convince you to design a smile just for me. Yes, I do want to be your friend. I want to be your best friend in the entire world.

quotes.quote: My alone feels so good, I'll only have you if you're sweeter than my solitude.

quotes.quote: الكراهية تكلف أكثر من الحب.. لأنها إحساس غير طبيعي.. إحساس عكسي مثل حركة الأجسام ضد جاذبية الأرض.. تحتاج إلى قوة إضافية وتستهلك وقوداً أكثر

quotes.quote: Crows remember human faces. They remember the people who feed them, who are kind to them. And the people who wrong them too. They don’t forget. They tell each other who to look after and who to watch out for.

quotes.quote: That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.

quotes.quote: I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.

quotes.quote: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.

quotes.quote: You - you alone will have the stars as no one else has them...In one of the stars I shall be living. In one of them I shall be laughing. And so it will be as if all the stars were laughing, when you look at the sky at night...You - only you - will have stars that can laugh.

quotes.quote: When we are children we seldom think of the future. This innocence leaves us free to enjoy ourselves as few adults can. The day we fret about the future is the day we leave our childhood behind.

quotes.quote: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation. What is called resignation is confirmed desperation. From the desperate city you go into the desperate country, and have to console yourself with the bravery of minks and muskrats. A stereotyped but unconscious despair is concealed even under what are called the games and amusements of mankind. There is no play in them, for this comes after work. But it is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things..

quotes.quote: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.

quotes.quote: What is honor compared to a woman's love? What is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms . . . or the memory of a brother's smile? Wind and words. Wind and words. We are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. That is our great glory, and our great tragedy.

quotes.quote: This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.

quotes.author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

quotes.quote: If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a great deal faster than it does.
quotes.author: Lewis Caroll

quotes.quote: Listen up - there's no war that will end all wars.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.quote: There is no point treating a depressed person as though she were just feeling sad, saying, 'There now, hang on, you'll get over it.' Sadness is more or less like a head cold- with patience, it passes. Depression is like cancer.
quotes.author: Barbara Kingsolver

quotes.quote: Spring is the time of plans and projects.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: Children learn more from what you are than what you teach.
quotes.author: W.E.B. DuBois

quotes.quote: If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.quote: Talking to a drunk person was like talking to an extremely happy, severely brain-damaged three-year-old.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.quote: Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.quote: Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.quote: Maybe this world is another planet’s hell.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote: Fiction is the lie through which we tell the truth.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar
quotes.book: Raising Positive Kids in a Negative World

quotes.quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote: What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.quote: Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.quote: Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got.
quotes.author: Philip José Farmer

quotes.quote: Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do.
quotes.author: Terry McMillan

quotes.quote: With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.
quotes.author: Margaret Mitchell

quotes.quote: Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks

quotes.quote: No good deed goes unpunished.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote:
God alert!" Blackjack yelled. "It's the wine dude!
Mr. D sighed in exasperation. "The next person, or horse, who calls me the 'wine dude' will end up in a bottle of Merlot!
quotes.author: Rick Riordan

quotes.quote:
There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out
but I'm too tough for him,
I say, stay in there, I'm not going to let anybody see you.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.quote: Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.quote:
How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.
I love thee to the depth and breadth and height
My soul can reach
quotes.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quotes.quote: District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.
quotes.author: Suzanne Collins

quotes.quote: Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.quote:
You could say sorry," suggested Harry bluntly.
"What, and get attacked by another flock of canaries?" muttered Ron.
"What did you have to imitate her for?"
"She laughed at my mustache!"
"So did I, it was the stupidest thing I've ever seen.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

quotes.quote: He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.
quotes.author: Gabriel García Márquez
quotes.book: Love in the Time of Cholera

quotes.quote: The unfed mind devours itself.
quotes.author: Gore Vidal

quotes.quote: Nobody gets everything in this life. You decide your priorities and you make your choices. I'd decided long ago that any cake I had would be eaten.
quotes.author: Donald E. Westlake

quotes.quote: When someone you love dies, and you're not expecting it, you don't lose her all at once; you lose her in pieces over a long time—the way the mail stops coming, and her scent fades from the pillows and even from the clothes in her closet and drawers. Gradually, you accumulate the parts of her that are gone. Just when the day comes—when there's a particular missing part that overwhelms you with the feeling that she's gone, forever—there comes another day, and another specifically missing part.
quotes.author: John Irving

quotes.quote: I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.
quotes.author: David Henry Hwang

quotes.quote: My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote: Art and love are the same thing: It’s the process of seeing yourself in things that are not you.
quotes.author: Chuck Klosterman
quotes.book: Killing Yourself to Live: 85% of a True Story

quotes.quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote:
I am looking for friends. What does that mean -- tame?"

"It is an act too often neglected," said the fox. "It means to establish ties."

"To establish ties?"

"Just that," said the fox. "To me, you are still nothing more than a little boy who is just like a hundred thousand other little boys. And I have no need of you. And you, on your part, have no need of me. To you I am nothing more than a fox like a hundred thousand other foxes. But if you tame me, then we shall need each other. To me, you will be unique in all the world. To you, I shall be unique in all the world....
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quotes.quote: The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love.
quotes.author: William Wordsworth

quotes.quote: There is no such thing as bad people. We’re all just people who sometimes do bad things.
quotes.author: Colleen Hoover

quotes.quote:
Don't tell me," Jace said, "Simon's turned himself into an ocelot and you want me to do something about it before Isabelle makes him into a stole. Well, you'll have have to wait till tomorrow. I'm out of commission." He pointed at himself - he was wearing blue pajamas with a hole in the sleeve. "Look. Jammies."
"Jace," Clary said, "this is important."
"Don't tell me," he said. "You've got a drawing emergency. You need a nude model. Well, I'm not in the mood. You could always ask Hodge," he said as an afterthought. "I hear he'll do anything for a -"
"JACE!" she interrupted him, her voice rising to a scream. "JUST SHUT UP FOR A SECOND AND LISTEN, WILL YOU?
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare

quotes.quote: Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.
quotes.author: David Byrne

quotes.quote: This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: Winter is coming.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.quote: A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.
quotes.author: Irina Dunn

quotes.quote: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.
quotes.author: Louisa May Alcott

quotes.quote: If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll
quotes.book: Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland / Through the Looking-Glass

quotes.quote: Yes, I was infatuated with you: I am still. No one has ever heightened such a keen capacity of physical sensation in me. I cut you out because I couldn't stand being a passing fancy. Before I give my body, I must give my thoughts, my mind, my dreams. And you weren't having any of those.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath
quotes.book: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

quotes.quote: Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.
quotes.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quotes.quote: Every now and then I like to do as I'm told, just to confuse people.
quotes.author: Tamora Pierce

quotes.quote: let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath
quotes.book: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

quotes.quote: Lighthouses don’t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining.
quotes.author: Anne Lamott

quotes.quote: Don't be so humble - you are not that great.
quotes.author: Golda Meir

quotes.quote: Maybe there is a beast… maybe it's only us.
quotes.author: William Golding

quotes.quote:
I meant," said Ipslore bitterly, "what is there in this world that truly makes living worthwhile?"
Death thought about it.
CATS, he said eventually. CATS ARE NICE.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.quote: It's possible to go on, no matter how impossible it seems, and that in time, the grief . . . lessens. It may not go away completely, but after a while it's not so overwhelming.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks

quotes.quote: I like good strong words that mean something…
quotes.author: Louisa May Alcott

quotes.quote: There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world.
quotes.author: L.M. Montgomery

quotes.quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.quote: I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had.
quotes.author: Margaret Mead

quotes.quote: It is thanks to my evening reading alone that I am still more or less sane.
quotes.author: W.G. Sebald

quotes.quote: I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else.
quotes.author: Joshua Slocum

quotes.quote:
Hope
Smiles from the threshold of the year to come,
Whispering 'it will be happier'...
quotes.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quotes.quote:
Name one hero who was happy."
I considered. Heracles went mad and killed his family; Theseus lost his bride and father; Jason's children and new wife were murdered by his old; Bellerophon killed the Chimera but was crippled by the fall from Pegasus' back.
"You can't." He was sitting up now, leaning forward.
"I can't."
"I know. They never let you be famous AND happy." He lifted an eyebrow. "I'll tell you a secret."
"Tell me." I loved it when he was like this.
"I'm going to be the first." He took my palm and held it to his. "Swear it."
"Why me?"
"Because you're the reason. Swear it."
"I swear it," I said, lost in the high color of his cheeks, the flame in his eyes.
"I swear it," he echoed.
We sat like that a moment, hands touching. He grinned.
"I feel like I could eat the world raw.
quotes.author: Madeline Miller

quotes.quote: I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.
quotes.author: Fitzgerald F. Scott

quotes.quote: Right now I’m having amnesia and déjà vu at the same time. I think I’ve forgotten this before.
quotes.author: Steven Wright

quotes.quote: Remember that wherever your heart is, there you will find your treasure.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.quote: I fell in love with her courage, her sincerity, and her flaming self respect. And it's these things I'd believe in, even if the whole world indulged in wild suspicions that she wasn't all she should be. I love her and it is the beginning of everything.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.quote:
To see a World in a Grain of Sand
And a Heaven in a Wild Flower,
Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand
And Eternity in an hour.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.quote: Don't Panic.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams
quotes.book: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy

quotes.quote: And that's the thing about people who mean everything they say. They think everyone else does too.
quotes.author: Khaled Hosseini

quotes.quote: Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia.
quotes.author: E.L. Doctorow

quotes.quote: Start writing, no matter what. The water does not flow until the faucet is turned on.
quotes.author: Louis L'Amour

quotes.quote: A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say.
quotes.author: Italo Calvino

quotes.quote: Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: No thief, however skillful, can rob one of knowledge, and that is why knowledge is the best and safest treasure to acquire.
quotes.author: L. Frank Baum

quotes.quote: What would men be without women? Scarce, sir...mighty scarce.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Cinderella? Snow White? What's that? An illness?
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quotes.quote: It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them.
quotes.author: Agatha Christie

quotes.quote: Treat everyone with politeness and kindness, not because they are nice, but because you are.
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: The more I see, the less I know for sure.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.quote: All endings are also beginnings. We just don't know it at the time.
quotes.author: Mitch Albom
quotes.book: The Five People You Meet in Heaven

quotes.quote: I believe the universe wants to be noticed. I think the universe is inprobably biased toward the consciousness, that it rewards intelligence in part because the universe enjoys its elegance being observed. And who am I, living in the middle of history, to tell the universe that it-or my observation of it-is temporary?
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.quote: Books. Cats. Life is Good.
quotes.author: Edward Gorey

quotes.quote: An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.quote: You know, one of the tragedies of real life is that there is no background music.
quotes.author: Annie Proulx

quotes.quote: Everyone has talent. What's rare is the courage to follow it to the dark places where it leads.
quotes.author: Erica Jong

quotes.quote: There was nowhere to go but everywhere, so just keep on rolling under the stars.
quotes.author: Jack Kerouac
quotes.book: On the Road: The Original Scroll

quotes.quote: We all have our time machines, don't we. Those that take us back are memories...And those that carry us forward, are dreams.
quotes.author: H.G. Wells

quotes.quote:
Be grateful for what you already have while you pursue your goals.
If you aren’t grateful for what you already have, what makes you think you would be happy with more.
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: Laters, baby.
quotes.author: E.L. James

quotes.quote: There are far, far better things ahead than any we leave behind.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.quote: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.quote:
Hope is the thing with feathers
That perches in the soul
And sings the tune without the words
And never stops at all.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.quote: Never laugh at live dragons.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes.
quotes.author: Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

quotes.quote: Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly.
quotes.author: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Some people care too much. I think it's called love.
quotes.author: A.A. Milne

quotes.quote:
Deep in the meadow, hidden far away
A cloak of leaves, a moonbeam ray
Forget your woes and let your troubles lay
And when it's morning again, they'll wash away
Here it's safe, here it's warm
Here the daisies guard you from every harm
Here your dreams are sweet and tomorrow brings them true
Here is the place where I love you.
quotes.author: Suzanne Collins

quotes.quote: I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.quote: One, remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Two, never give up work. Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it. Three, if you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.quote: I wanted so badly to lie down next to her on the couch, to wrap my arms around her and sleep. Not fuck, like in those movies. Not even have sex. Just sleep together in the most innocent sense of the phrase. But I lacked the courage and she had a boyfriend and I was gawky and she was gorgeous and I was hopelessly boring and she was endlessly fascinating. So I walked back to my room and collapsed on the bottom bunk, thinking that if people were rain, I was drizzle and she was hurricane.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.quote: I heard what you said. I’m not the silly romantic you think. I don’t want the heavens or the shooting stars. I don’t want gemstones or gold. I have those things already. I want…a steady hand. A kind soul. I want to fall asleep, and wake, knowing my heart is safe. I want to love, and be loved.
quotes.author: Shana Abe

quotes.quote: Eating and reading are two pleasures that combine admirably.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.quote: Here’s to books, the cheapest vacation you can buy.
quotes.author: Charlaine Harris

quotes.quote: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.quote: It is the unknown we fear when we look upon death and darkness, nothing more.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

quotes.quote: Sometimes you climb out of bed in the morning and you think, I'm not going to make it, but you laugh inside — remembering all the times you've felt that way.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.quote: You can talk with someone for years, everyday, and still, it won't mean as much as what you can have when you sit in front of someone, not saying a word, yet you feel that person with your heart, you feel like you have known the person for forever.... connections are made with the heart, not the tongue.
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.quote: Reading is one form of escape. Running for your life is another.
quotes.author: Lemony Snicket

quotes.quote: A guy and a girl can be just friends, but at one point or another, they will fall for each other...Maybe temporarily, maybe at the wrong time, maybe too late, or maybe forever
quotes.author: Dave Matthews Band

quotes.quote: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.
quotes.author: St. Augustine

quotes.quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional.
quotes.author: haruki murakami
quotes.book: What I Talk About When I Talk About Running

quotes.quote: I would have come for you. And if I couldn't walk, I'd crawl to you, and no matter how broken we were, we'd fight our way out together-knives drawn, pistols blazing. Because that's what we do. We never stop fighting.
quotes.author: Leigh Bardugo

quotes.quote: One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple.
quotes.author: Jack Kerouac

quotes.quote: How lucky I am to have known somebody and something that saying goodbye to is so damned awful.
quotes.author: Evans G. Valens
quotes.book: The Other Side of the Mountain: The Story of Jill Kinmont

quotes.quote: If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote:
If you're reading this...
Congratulations, you're alive.
If that's not something to smile about,
then I don't know what is.
quotes.author: Chad Sugg

quotes.quote: Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.quote: If we wait for the moment when everything, absolutely everything is ready, we shall never begin.
quotes.author: Ivan Turgenev

quotes.quote: Love is an untamed force. When we try to control it, it destroys us. When we try to imprison it, it enslaves us. When we try to understand it, it leaves us feeling lost and confused.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.quote: You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange.
quotes.author: Milan Kundera

quotes.quote: Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

quotes.quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Take pride in your pain; you are stronger than those who have none
quotes.author: Lois Lowry

quotes.quote: Never say 'no' to adventures. Always say 'yes,' otherwise you'll lead a very dull life.
quotes.author: Ian Fleming

quotes.quote: I nodded, looking at Rachel with respect. "You hit the Lord of the Titans in the eye with a blue plastic hairbrush.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan

quotes.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote:
How do you spell 'love'?" - Piglet
"You don't spell it...you feel it." - Pooh
quotes.author: A.A. Milne

quotes.quote: Happiness [is] only real when shared
quotes.author: Jon Krakauer

quotes.quote: Money can't buy happiness, but it can make you awfully comfortable while you're being miserable.
quotes.author: Clare Boothe Luce

quotes.quote: Though she be but little, she is fierce!
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: ‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: So it's you and a syringe against the Capitol? See, this is why no one lets you make the plans.
quotes.author: Suzanne Collins

quotes.quote: you can, you should, and if you’re brave enough to start, you will.
quotes.author: Stephen King
quotes.book: On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft

quotes.quote:
They’re not hideous,” said Tessa.
Will blinked at her. “What?”
“Gideon and Gabriel,” said Tessa. “They’re really quite good-looking, not hideous at all.”
“I spoke,” said Will, in sepulchral tones, “of the pitch-black inner depths of their souls.”
Tessa snorted. “And what color do you suppose the inner depths of your soul are, Will Herondale?”
“Mauve,” said Will.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare

quotes.quote:
So you're always honest," I said.
"Aren't you?"
"No," I told him. "I'm not."
"Well, that's good to know, I guess."
"I'm not saying I'm a liar," I told him. He raised his eyebrows. "That's not how I meant it, anyways."
"How'd you mean it, then?"
"I just...I don't always say what I feel."
"Why not?"
"Because the truth sometimes hurts," I said.
"Yeah," he said. "So do lies, though.
quotes.author: Sarah Dessen

quotes.quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.quote: You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read.
quotes.author: James Baldwin

quotes.quote: The meek may inherit the earth, but at the moment it belongs to the conceited. Like me.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare

quotes.quote: Let us learn to show our friendship for a man when he is alive and not after he is dead.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.quote: Every great love starts with a great story...
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks

quotes.quote:
What if it lines up like it did in the Trojan War ... Athena versus Poseidon?"
"I don't know. But I just know that I'll be fighting next to you."
"Why?"
"Because you're my friend, Seaweed Brain. Any more stupid questions?
quotes.author: Rick Riordan

quotes.quote: There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote:
silence is the language of god,
all else is poor translation.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.quote: My library is an archive of longings.
quotes.author: Susan Sontag
quotes.book: As Consciousness is Harnessed to Flesh: Journals and Notebooks, 1964-1980

quotes.quote: You can have it all. Just not all at once.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin
quotes.book: Memoirs of the life & writings of Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: I'm saying that I'm a moody, insecure, narrow-minded, jealous, borderline homicidal bitch, and I want you to promise me that you're okay with that, because it's who I am, and you're what I need.
quotes.author: Jeaniene Frost

quotes.quote: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.
quotes.author: Lao Tsu

quotes.quote:
Sonnet XVII

I do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz,
or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off.
I love you as certain dark things are to be loved,
in secret, between the shadow and the soul.

I love you as the plant that never blooms
but carries in itself the light of hidden flowers;
thanks to your love a certain solid fragrance,
risen from the earth, lives darkly in my body.

I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where.
I love you straightforwardly, without complexities or pride;
so I love you because I know no other way than this:

where I does not exist, nor you,
so close that your hand on my chest is my hand,
so close that your eyes close as I fall asleep.
quotes.author: Pablo Neruda

quotes.quote: There are good days and hard days for me—even now. Don’t let the hard days win.
quotes.author: Sarah J. Maas
quotes.book: A Court of Mist and Fury

quotes.quote: A child can teach an adult three things: to be happy for no reason, to always be busy with something, and to know how to demand with all his might that which he desires.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.quote: I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.
quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quotes.quote: Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It's about learning to dance in the rain.
quotes.author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

quotes.quote: It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.
quotes.author: Patrick Rothfuss

quotes.quote: Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know.
quotes.author: Eoin Colfer

quotes.quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
quotes.author: Confucious

quotes.quote: Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin
